::: {.tour-intro .text-center .py-4}
This **offbeat itinerary** takes you deep into the hidden treasures of North Bengal. From the tribal villages of **Panbu** and orange orchards of **Sittong** to the colonial cantonments of **Takdah** and the legendary tea gardens of **Darjeeling**, every stop on this journey is a blend of scenic beauty and untold history.
:::

::: {.history-insight .callout-note}
#### ğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Kalimpong
Once a vibrant hub on the **Silk Route** between India and Tibet via the Jelep La Pass. The town was controlled by the Bhutanese and later the British, making it a center of politics and commerce.
:::

### DAY 3: Kalimpong to Sittong â€“ The Orange Village
:::
::: {.day-route}

::: {.day-content}
:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="60%"}
#### Today's Experience

- Drive to **Sittong**, famously known as the "Orange Village".
- En route, stop at the historic **Coronation Bridge**.
- Visit **Ahaldara Viewpoint** for breathtaking views of the Teesta loop.
- Explore the **local orange orchards** (best in winter).
- Visit the bamboo church and traditional Lepcha houses.

:::

::: {.column width="40%"}

::: {.history-insight .callout-note}
#### ğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Lepcha Heritage
Sittong is a stronghold of the **Lepcha tribe**, the indigenous people of the Himalayas. Their deep connection to nature is reflected in their bamboo architecture and sustainable farming practices.
:::

:::

::: {.day-content}
:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="60%"}
#### Today's Experience

- Transfer to **Takdah**, a misty hamlet frozen in time.
- Visit the **Orchid Center** (one of the best in Asia).
- Explore the **Tinchuley Gumbadara Viewpoint**.
- Walk through the **Rungli Rungliot Tea Garden**.
- Stay in a **heritage British Bungalow** (if available).

:::

::: {.column width="40%"}

::: {.history-insight .callout-note}
#### ğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ British Takdah
Takdah started as a **British military cantonment** during World War I (1915-1919). The officers built numbered bungalows here (e.g., Bungalow No. 12), many of which still stand today as heritage homestays.
:::
:::

::: {.day-content}
:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="60%"}
#### Today's Experience

- Drive to Darjeeling via the scenic **Lamahatta Eco Park**.
- Arrive in Darjeeling by afternoon.
- Evening leisure walk on the **Mall Road (Chowrasta)**.
- Visit **Glenary's** or **Keventer's** for colonial-era confectioneries.
- Shop for Darjeeling Tea and woolens.

:::

::: {.column width="40%"}

::: {.history-insight .callout-note}
#### ğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Summer Capital
Established by the **British East India Company** in the 1830s, Darjeeling became the "Summer Capital of Bengal." It was developed as a sanatorium and later became the center of the world's most famous tea industry.
:::
